channel.title: Voice Actor Needed! - HECU SOLDIER
channel.description:
Crowbar Collective is looking for a NEW voice for the HECU Soldier!
The ideal applicant will provide dry recordings from a dead room. I know that sounds gross, so let me clarify.
A dry recording is a recording with no added effects. We are more interested in your performance than your audio mixing skills. A dead room is a quiet, echo-free recording space. No reverb, street sounds, roommates, hisses or hums in the background.
We're also looking for somebody with access to quality recording equipment, and the ability to record while on Skype for voice direction.
We hope this opportunity will bring in a lot of talented actors, so please understand that we will not be able to respond to every application. We'll let you know when we want to hear more.
We'd also like to know which voice the community prefers. Once you're done, feel free to share the audition with your fellow interwebbers! [b]#blackmesavoice #newhecu #crowbarcollective[/b]
If you don't think you have the pipes/gear for the job, then please help point any qualified voice actors towards this jobs posting.
Email [email]jobs@blackmesasource.com[/email] with an outline of:
* the equipment you used during recording * your availability * the files/links of your Black Mesa recordings * if available, files/links for any past voice acting work
Thanks! [quote] [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WMF0AuFuUws']Original Half-Life HECU soldier[/url]
[url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JVPAzthlE-Y']Black Mesa HECU soldier to be replaced[/url]
[b]CHARACTER[/b]
* I've killed twelve of these dumbass scientists, and not one of 'ems fought back... This SUCKS! * I didn't sign on for this shit. Monsters? Hell yeah. But civilians? Who ordered this damn operation anyway?
[b]DISCUSSION[/b] (You only need to record one scene, but please play both soldiers)
HECU 1: Where are we taking this Freeman guy? HECU 2: Topside for questioning. HECU 1: What the hell for? We got him. Let's kill him now. HECU 2: Uh... and if they find the body? HECU 1: Body? What body? HECU 1 & 2 laugh.
[i]- OR -[/i]
HECU 1: So, who is this guy, Freeman? HECU 2: They say he was at Ground Zero. HECU 1: Science team... You think he was responsible? Sabotage, maybe? HECU 2: Yeah, maybe. All I know for sure is he's been killing my buddies. HECU 1: Oh yeah, he'll pay. He will definitely pay.
[b]COMBAT[/b] (This section is meant to show how well your gear can hold up to yelling, screaming, high-energy performances)
* Shit! We got hostiles! * Squad! Stay down! * Squad! We got Freeman! * We've got uglies! * Loose frag! * Go! Recon! * Medic! * Move in! * Clear this area!
[b]CHATTER[/b]
* Recon in position. All quiet. * Squad, spread out. * Movement check, over. * Look-out, check in. * Sector Secure. Over. * That's an affirmative, sir. * This mission is way beyond FUBAR. * OK mission, zero niner. * Look-out Post: All quiet. Over. * Sir, I hear something.
[b]EXTRA CREDIT[/b] Send us a short piece (maximum 1 min) of your HECU Soldier in a scenario of your choosing. This does not have to be constrained to a Half-Life combat situation. You can put your own twist on the character. Read passages from medical dictionaries, freestyle rap, yell at your neighbors no good dog that just won't shut up. We're looking forward to hearing what you come up with. [/quote]

item.title: Voice Actor Needed! - HECU SOLDIER
item.dc:creator: Sieben
item.description:
Albus:

Pity my voice won’t suit, since I am 19 years old

Well, considering this thread is 5 years old, your voice would have been even less suitable since you were 14 when they actually needed it

Read full topic

item.title: Voice Actor Needed! - HECU SOLDIER
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Also, FUBAR is alternately defined as “Fucked Up Beyond All Repair.” Actual jargon also has plenty of other abbreviations, like SNAFU or TARFU. The latter-most is pretty appropriate for Black Mesa- “Things Are Really Fucked Up.”

Read full topic

item.title: Voice Actor Needed! - HECU SOLDIER
item.dc:creator: ovalh3
item.description:
If anyone wants a good reference for what marines would realistically sound like in combat, I think DICE actually did an amazing job with their voice work for BF3 and BF4.

Here’s a bunch of sound bits some guy compiled from both games:
(Attacking)
https://youtu.be/dQ8pT4JKn-0
https://youtu.be/9J4qZtfv1g8
(Defending)
https://youtu.be/CYtsCyJQJ4A?list=UUVrJCEuAwjaggsDcg0_JbWA
https://youtu.be/djGmFE-qOpc
(Man Down)
https://youtu.be/h77RKX0cPk0?list=UUVrJCEuAwjaggsDcg0_JbWA

And here’s him actually trying some of them out in Black Mesa:
https://youtu.be/LVcDrmPfX7I
https://youtu.be/SZTfd8eXFsk
https://youtu.be/xC4PdgKOFo4

Read full topic

item.title: Voice Actor Needed! - HECU SOLDIER
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Just throwing it in here.
Can you not just ask Valve on what they did to distort the voices in HL1?

P.S. Got amused by this.

the sentence would then be “This mission is way beyond fucked up beyond all recognition.” That makes no sense.

But they actually say

‘This mission is way beyond FUBAR’

and not

‘This mission is way beyond fucked up beyond all recognition’, right?

If you would’ve been less of a wise-ass, you’d have realised that FUBAR is an actual established adjective. Therefore the rules that apply for any other adjectives apply here as well.

Besides:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CKBkfg5SYQk&list=PLqv2Udc4gZ9Qp-xJrgCcM4xhC9VG3MhJv&index=5

Read full topic

item.title: Voice Actor Needed! - HECU SOLDIER
item.dc:creator: Cup_o_Joe
item.description:
I vote for Eric Brown, all the combat sounds sound true to the original but in higher quality. Good talent.
One scene I think you should redo though is the On a Rail Rocket scene, the guy who says “all I know is he’s been killing my buddies” sounds like Jethro from Beverly hillbillies.

Read full topic

item.title: Voice Actor Needed! - HECU SOLDIER
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Since this is still open, I’d better get some lines done!

EDIT: Argh, my microphone is being super shitty when I’m yelling into it. Sound gets soooo distorted.

EDIT #2: I have a second mic- an old Xbox throat mic I got back when Modern Warfare 2 was in its heyday. It has the benefit of a tinny sound to it, making my voice already sound a bit like its been run through a high pass filter and is much quieter, so I can project more.

EDIT #3: Actually, loud dialog sounds EVEN SHITTIER. Argh. I think I’ll wait for tomorrow morning to let my vocal chords recharge, and then try it with the mic on my HV30 camera to see if I can cut down on the distortion.

Read full topic

item.title: Voice Actor Needed! - HECU SOLDIER
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
I hope all the people who submitted at the wrong address found out about the new one…

It’d be a real shame to miss out on some talent because of a fatal mistake like that.

Maybe you should try to spread awareness, first by contacting people in the thread who said they submitted theirs, then by posting news of the mistake in other places.

Read full topic

item.title: Voice Actor Needed! - HECU SOLDIER
item.dc:creator: MotoXpro
item.description:
SirChronocide:

Alright, sent in my audition. I was worried that little improve section I thought up while in the booth would go over a minute; turns out it was just barley in the safe zone! I also made a wet mix in 5 minutes just for the hell of it. Let me know what you guys think and what I could do to improve!

Dry Mix

Wet Mix

You sound like the postal dude to me.

Read full topic

You should really consider changing the “We’ve got uglies” line back to “We’ve got hostiles”. The chapter WGH was named after it, it just doesn’t make a lot of sense to have it gone.
